sponsor: United States Army Institute of Surgical Research
briefTitle: Effect of rFVIIa on Peri-operative Blood Loss in Patients Undergoing Major Burn
officialTitle: Effect of Recombinant Coagulation Factor VIIa on Peri-operative Blood Loss in Patients Undergoing Major Burn Excision and Grafting
summary: The purpose of the study is to see if a medication (Recombinant Coagulation Factor VIIa or NovoSeven), normally used to stop bleeding in persons with a bleeding disorder, will lower the amount of blood lost during burn surgery.

primaryOutcome.measure: Total Number of Blood Components Transfused During and up to 24 Hours Post Operatively
